subsection.name: 4.3 Select Queries: Retrieving Objects
subsection.p: To give users access to the existing database data, Cayenne provides extensive query API. Queries in Cayenne are Java objects that create abstraction independent from SQL dialect used by the target database. SQL queries not covered by Cayenne can also be performed. This is done using wrappers around SQL statements (SqlSelectQuery and SqlModfyQuery).

subsection.name: 4.3.2 Qualifiers
subsection.p: Of course in the real life situations programmers would need a more fine control of what objects should be retrieved from the database. In this case qualifier expression should be used. Qualifier is an instance of a class implementing Expression interface. The easiest way to build valid expressions is by using ExpressionFactory class. Extending the previous example, here is how to add an expression that would tell Cayenne to fetch artists that have a name that starts with "John":

Note that we are using a method "binaryPathExpression" to create an expresion. "Binary" indicates the fact that the target expression has two operands. "Path" indicates that second argument, the left hand operand of a binary expression ("artistName"), will be converted to a "path expression" - expression of type Expression.OBJ_PATH. This is a special type of expressions that allows to specify attributes and related entities relative to the query root entity. So in this example "artistName" when resolved relative to the entity "Artist" is just an attribute of "Artist".
